title: What was the steam engine used for? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is still “used for”. In the first case it was used to pump water by Newcomen and then Watt. Then it was used for “stationary” engines to power other things with rotary motion and then mounted on a frame to build a crude car by Cugnot. It was also put on a frame to act as a locomotive to pull wagons for coal mines and then on to pull passenger trains.

It would be easier to state what the steam engine was not used for. It was the power for the industrial revolution. It was used on farms, in ships, machine shops and factories to provide power everything from running cotton gins, to manufacturing guns and early automobiles. If there was a need for rotary or reciprocal power the steam engine was used.

It was the basic prime mover of the early industrial revolution. From steam locomotives, to huge stationary steam engines powering overhead belt systems that powered all the machinery in most manufacturing. Steam paddelwheel boats, even steam powered saw mills,and cars
